seriesJson.title: New directions in social sciences
seriesJson.description: A series of talks delivered before the annual convention of the American Psychological Association in San Francisco.

node.title: Effects of male hormones on women
node.description: This program presents a talk by John I. Wheeler called "Psychological Effects of Male Hormones on Women."

node.title: Current and future advances
node.description: This program presents a talk by Harry F. Harlow, Psychology Department, University of Wisconsin called "Current and Future Advances in Comparative Psychology."

node.title: Psychopathology and politics
node.description: This program presents the first part of a talk by Harold Lasswell, Yale Law School, and Richard Christie, Research Center for Human Relations, called "Psychopathology and Politics."

node.title: Psychopathology and politics
node.description: This program presents the second part of a talk by Harold Lasswell, Yale Law School, and Richard Christie, Research Center for Human Relations, called "Psychopathology and Politics."

node.title: Interviews with American males
node.description: Harold Renaud, "Life History Interviews with American Males."

node.title: Extensions of psychological concept
node.description: Franz Alexander, Institute for Psychoanalysis, Chicago, "Extensions of Psychological Concepts."

node.title: Analogy in science
node.description: The first part of Dr. J. Robert Oppenheimer's keynote address, "Analogy in Science."

node.title: Analogy in science
node.description: The conclusion of Dr. J. Robert Oppenheimer's keynote address, "Analogy in Science."
